title: Welcome to Cortex Pre-Sales Arsenal
excerpt: A centralized platform for discovering, sharing, and promoting innovative Cortex ecosystem projects.
author: Arsenal Team
content:
# Welcome to the Cortex Pre-Sales Arsenal

We're excited to introduce the **Cortex Pre-Sales Arsenal** - your centralized hub for discovering, sharing, and promoting innovative tools and projects across the Palo Alto Networks Cortex ecosystem.

## What is the Arsenal?

The Arsenal is a curated collection of:

- **Pre-sales tools** and demos
- **SOC optimization playbooks**
- **Integration frameworks**
- **Training environments**
- **Testing utilities**

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Community Projects] --> B{Review Process}
    B --> C[Incubation Pipeline]
    C --> D[Quality Assessment]
    D --> E{Promotion Decision}
    E -->|Approved| F[Arsenal Release]
    E -->|Needs Work| C
    F --> G[Pre-Sales Teams]
    F --> H[Regional Rollout]
    F --> I[Global Distribution]
```

## Key Features

### ðŸš€ Auto-Import from GitHub
Automatically discovers and imports repositories from watched organizations:
- Palo-Cortex (Official PANW Cortex team)
- Community contributors

### ðŸŽ¯ Intelligent Categorization
Projects are automatically tagged by:
- **Product**: XSIAM, XDR, XSOAR, Prisma Cloud, Strata
- **Use Case**: Monitoring, Testing, Automation, SOC Ops
- **Status**: Active, Development, Beta, Deprecated

### ðŸ“Š Promotion Pipeline
High-quality projects undergo:
1. Nomination by champions
2. Documentation review
3. Quality validation
4. Production readiness assessment
5. Promotion to Arsenal releases

## Getting Started

```bash
# Clone the Arsenal
git clone https://github.com/Palo-Cortex/cortex-arsenal

# Install dependencies
npm install

# Start exploring
npm run dev
```

## Statistics

| Metric | Count |
|--------|-------|
| Total Projects | 20 |
| Active Tools | 18 |
| SOC Playbooks | 11 |
| In Incubation | 3 |

## Join the Community

Contribute your projects, share feedback, and help us build the best pre-sales toolkit in the industry!

[Submit a Project](/submit) | [View Arsenal](/arsenal) | [Documentation](https://github.com/Palo-Cortex)

title: New AI-Powered Documentation Features
excerpt: Automatic README generation and quality validation now available to standardize submissions.
author: Arsenal Team
content:
# AI-Powered Documentation Features

## Overview

We've introduced intelligent documentation extraction and validation to ensure every project in the Arsenal meets quality standards.

## New Capabilities

### ðŸ“„ Automatic README Parsing

```typescript
interface DocumentationExtractor {
  readme: string;
  setup?: string;
  deployment?: string;
  api?: string;
  troubleshooting?: string;
}
```

The system now automatically:
- Extracts README content from repositories
- Identifies setup/installation instructions
- Parses API documentation
- Detects troubleshooting guides

### âœ… Quality Validation

```mermaid
flowchart LR
    A[Project Submitted] --> B{README Present?}
    B -->|No| C[Auto-generate]
    B -->|Yes| D{Quality Check}
    D -->|Pass| E[Approved]
    D -->|Fail| F[Request Improvements]
    C --> D
```

### ðŸŽ¯ Validation Rules

1. **Minimum length**: 100 characters
2. **Required sections**:
   - Description
   - Installation
   - Usage
3. **Code examples**: At least one
4. **Links validation**: All URLs must be reachable

## Impact

> **85% improvement** in documentation consistency across the Arsenal

## Example

Before:
```markdown
# My Tool
A tool for XSIAM.
```

After:
```markdown
# XSIAM Alert Enrichment Tool

## Overview
Automated enrichment pipeline for XSIAM alerts using threat intelligence APIs.

## Installation
\`\`\`bash
pip install xsiam-enrichment
\`\`\`

## Usage
\`\`\`python
from xsiam_enrichment import enrich_alert
result = enrich_alert(alert_id)
\`\`\`
```

## Try It Now

Submit your project and see the AI documentation assistant in action!

content:
# SOC Playbooks Library Expansion

## New Vendor Integrations

We've significantly expanded our SOC playbooks library with 11 new vendor-specific integration packs.

### Added Integrations

```mermaid
mindmap
  root((SOC Playbooks))
    EDR/XDR
      Crowdstrike Falcon
      Microsoft Defender
      Trend Micro Vision One
    Email Security
      Proofpoint TAP
      Microsoft Graph Security
    Threat Intelligence
      Free TI Feeds
      MITRE ATT&CK
    Framework
      Common Playbooks
      SOC Toolkit
      Optimization Framework
```

## Key Features

### ðŸ”„ Automated Response
All playbooks include:
- Auto-enrichment workflows
- Incident response procedures  
- Escalation logic
- Remediation actions

### ðŸ“Š Metrics Dashboard

| Integration | Playbooks | Use Cases |
|-------------|-----------|----------|
| Crowdstrike | 8 | EDR alerts, threat hunting |
| MS Defender | 12 | Endpoint protection, email |
| Proofpoint | 6 | Email threats, URL analysis |
| Trend Micro | 5 | Cloud workload protection |

### ðŸŽ¯ MITRE ATT&CK Mapping

Every playbook is mapped to MITRE techniques:

```python
# Example: Crowdstrike Falcon Alert Handler
MITRE_TECHNIQUES = [
    "T1059",  # Command and Scripting Interpreter
    "T1055",  # Process Injection
    "T1027",  # Obfuscated Files or Information
]
```

## Getting Started

### Installation

```bash
# Clone the SOC Framework
git clone https://github.com/Palo-Cortex/soc-optimization

# Install dependencies
cd soc-optimization
pip install -r requirements.txt

# Import playbooks
python import_playbooks.py --vendor crowdstrike
```

### Configuration

```yaml
# config.yml
integrations:
  crowdstrike:
    api_key: ${CROWDSTRIKE_API_KEY}
    base_url: https://api.crowdstrike.com
    
  microsoft_defender:
    tenant_id: ${AZURE_TENANT_ID}
    client_id: ${AZURE_CLIENT_ID}
```

## What's Next?

Upcoming integrations:
- SentinelOne
- Carbon Black
- Palo Alto Networks Cortex XDR (native)

Stay tuned!
